definition: to hang or suspend (from a hook etc)/to hang up (the phone)/(of a line) to be dead/to be worried or concerned/to make a phone call (dialect)/to register or record/classifier for sets or clusters of objects/(slang) to kill/to die/to be finished/to fail (an exam)
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Kim tells her that she is on her way and they hang up.
sentences.chinese: 金姆說她就在去反恐組的路上，然後掛斷了電話。

sentences.english: When making a phone call, which side have to hang up first?
sentences.chinese: 打電話時，應由哪一方先掛斷？

sentences.english: I said yes agreeably , and hanged off.
sentences.chinese: 我欣然地說好的，然後就掛斷了。

sentences.english: The official eventually hung up after she explained and apologized.
sentences.chinese: 最終在她一番解釋並道歉之後，這位官員掛斷了電話。

sentences.english: Solutions to financial pressures require you making that phone call you've been putting off. Call and learn to trust in love again.
sentences.chinese: 要解決財政壓力，需要你去打那通被掛斷的電話。

sentences.english: He threatens to kill Kimberly, and Jack hangs up abruptly.
sentences.chinese: 他威脅要殺了金伯利，傑克卻猛地掛斷了電話。

sentences.english: No confirmation Address , Wang Jing to hang up the phone.
sentences.chinese: 還沒確認地址，王靜就掛斷了電話。

sentences.english: So I had to hang up a mosquito-net.
sentences.chinese: 以是我必須掛斷蚊子傳播網。

sentences.english: Winds have also disrupted electrical wires, cutting the electricity supply to one local community.
sentences.chinese: 大風還掛斷了電線，造成了一個居民小區停電。

sentences.english: As I hung up the phone, the man in the recliner stood up.
sentences.chinese: 我掛斷電話，這名男子在爐站立起來。

sentences.english: Nika just says she’s sorry and hangs up.
sentences.chinese: Nika說了聲抱歉然後掛斷了電話。

sentences.english: When making a phone call, which side should hang up first?
sentences.chinese: 打電話時，應由哪一方先掛斷？

sentences.english: Game's up. homie, hang it up like some crank calls.
sentences.chinese: 遊戲結束了，哥們，掛斷它就像是接到奇怪的電話。

sentences.english: Mr. Mercer ?There was a call for you but I'm afraid your party was cut off.
sentences.chinese: 馬撒先生嗎？有一通您的電話，但是對方恐怕掛斷了。

sentences.english: Please hold my telephone calls and just take a message. I can call back later.
sentences.chinese: 請別掛斷我的電話，先留個言，我一會兒會再打來的。

definition: to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
to reply to a telegram/to wire back
lit. quick sword cuts through tangled hemp (idiom); decisive action in a complex situation/cutting the Gordian knot
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
to get straight to the point (idiom)
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: to be made a scapegoat/to be unjustly blamed
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
